name: Dual Purpose Warrior: Fighter 8/ Bard 3/ AA 9
author: Mick Dagger

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
If you try to keep this dangerous warrior at a distance, you will be pounded by her lethal arrows. And if you close in on her, like you would do with any other annoying archer, her shield will block your attack, and she will hammer you to the ground.

Fighter(8), Bard(3), Arcane Archer(9), Half-Elf

STR: 17 (22)
DEX: 13
CON: 14
WIS: 8
INT: 14
CHA: 8

Half-Elf - any non-lawful alignment

01: Fighter(1): Expertise, Knockdown
02: Fighter(2): Weapon Focus: Warhammer*
03: Fighter(3): Weapon Focus: Longbow

*You may pick another one-handed melee weapon here

Saving Throw bonuses: Spells: +5, Mind Effects: +2

BAB: 19
AB (plain weapon): +26/+21/+16/+11 (warhammer), +26/+21/+16/+11 (longbow)
Damage:
Warhammer: 1d8 +8 (19-20/x3)
Longbow: 1d8 +7 (add 1-6 with mighty bows) (19-20/x3)

AC, naked: 15
AC (mundane full plate/ +tower-shield): 23/26
Expertise: AC+5

Special abilities: Bard song level 3: AB +1, Damage +2, Saves F/W/R: +1/+1/0. Imbue arrow, Seeker arrow, Hail of arrows.
Spell Casting: Bards can use arcane scrolls. UMD gives access to other items that hold spells.
Alignment Changes: 0

Skills:
Skillpoints: 116
Discipline 23(29), Listen 19(19), Perform 10(9), Spellcraft 23(25), Tumble 20(21), UMD 21(20)

14: Listen(1), Save(6),
15: Listen(1), Save(11),
16: Listen(1), Save(16),
17: Save(22),
18: Discipline(6), Save(20),
19: Discipline(1), Save(23),
20: Discipline(1), Perform(3), Spellcraft(10), Tumble(5), UMD(10),

Strengths:
This character fights equally well in melee- as in archery combat, and deals heavy damage in any situation.
The bow attack pierces stoneskins and premonition.
Can use arcane scrolls and almost any item.
Has a good skill-set
Can boost her fighting prowess with bard song

Weaknesses:
A low will save, a bit better vs spells, but still low. Drink clarity potions, or cast mind/fear protection spells from scrolls, or get mind/fear protection from items.
210 HP is so-so for a tanking character. You may want to boost constitution with potions or items.

Tweak:
The character can take the taunt skill. Taunting can take away -6AC from your target, effectively increasing your AB by +6. You may combine it with Expertise for +5 to AC and +1 to AB, and if you take the Power attack feat (instead of Expertise or IKD) +1 to AB and +5 to damage. You will have to find the skillpoints for taunt somewhere, and it will come at a cost. Perform, Spellcraft and UMD are candidates.

posts.author: Stylish1
posts.content:
Is this build possible?

Arcane Archers need 1st level arcane spells which a bard level 1 does not have. Also, doesn't he need 11 charisma to be able to cast 1st level spells?

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Stylish1 wrote: Is this build possible?

Arcane Archers need 1st level arcane spells which a bard level 1 does not have. Also, doesn't he need 11 charisma to be able to cast 1st level spells?
A fair question. However, AA only requires a level of an arcane class - not the ability to cast spells. If you took Bard at level 1, you would be right about needing 11 charisma, but you don't when taking it any time later in a build. Here, Bard is taken for i) access to AA, ii) access to skills: Tumble, UMD and Spellcraft, and iii) Bard Song. It's not being taken for spell-casting.

Hope this helps (and hope Mick agrees!)

Cheers
